content.question: The weak acid <math alttext="C H 3 C O O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a <math alttext="p K sub a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of 4.76. A solution is prepared by mixing <math alttext="500 decimal point milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.150 molar C H 3 C O O H aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.150</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="0.0200 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N a O H solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following can be used to calculate the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the solution?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.0200 over 0.150, which equals 3.88" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log(</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>3.88</mtext></mrow></math>

<math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.0200 over 0.0750, which equals 4.19" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log(</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0750</mn></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>4.19</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.0200 over 0.0550, which equals 4.32" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log(</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0550</mn></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>4.32</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.0950 over 0.0750, which equals 4.86" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log(</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.0950</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0750</mn></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>4.86</mn></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.0200 over 0.0550, which equals 4.32" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log(</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0550</mn></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>4.32</mn></mrow></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
